name: Goldbach Conjecture
latex: \text{Every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two primes}
explanation: Christian Goldbach's 1742 conjecture is one of the oldest unsolved problems in number theory. It states that every even number greater than 2 is the sum of two prime numbers. For example: 4 = 2 + 2, 6 = 3 + 3, 8 = 3 + 5, 10 = 3 + 7 = 5 + 5. The conjecture has been verified for all even numbers up to 4 × 10¹⁸, but no general proof exists. It's a simple statement about prime numbers that has resisted solution for nearly 300 years.

examples.problem: Express 20 as the sum of two primes
steps: Find pairs of primes that sum to 20
The conjecture says at least one such pair exists

examples.solution: Verified up to 4 × 10¹⁸, but unproven in general
steps: Computers have checked billions of even numbers
All checked numbers satisfy the conjecture
But this doesn't constitute a proof
The weak Goldbach conjecture (for odd numbers ≥ 7) was proven in 2013
The strong conjecture (for even numbers) remains open

proof: Status: UNSOLVED. Despite being verified for trillions of cases, no general proof exists. The problem is deceptively simple but connects to deep questions about the distribution of prime numbers.
